title: Register
text:
NPC19 Registration Rates

APA's National Planning Conference offers high-level education and unmatched networking opportunities that return extraordinary professional value for every dollar spent.

 

Register for NPC19

 

Registration Rates

APA Member & NPC Speaker

Regular Pricing – $735

Register by February 13, 2019

This registration is for standard APA memberships.

Registration includes:

  • Full program access
  • Welcome Reception
  • Exhibit Hall Happy Hour
  • Awards luncheon invitation
  • Post-conference access to presentations/recordings

Additional fees may apply to ticketed events.

APA New Member

Regular Pricing – $368

Register by February 13, 2019

This registration is for new APA memberships. Want to take advantage of this great rate?
Find out more about joining APA at half-off regular member dues

Registration includes:

  • Full program access
  • Welcome Reception
  • Exhibit Hall Happy Hour
  • Awards luncheon invitation
  • Post-conference access to presentations/recordings

Additional fees may apply to ticketed events. New member rates are only applicable for U.S. residents.

APA Life, Retired, & Student Member

Regular Pricing – $125

Register by February 13, 2019

This registration is for APA life, retired and student memberships.

Registration includes:

  • Full program access
  • Welcome Reception
  • Exhibit Hall Happy Hour
  • Post-conference access to presentations/recordings

Additional fees may apply to ticketed events.

Nonmember Planning Official

Regular Pricing – $735

Register by February 13, 2019

This registration is for nonmember planning officials, such as planning commissioners and elected or appointed officials, and who do not earn their living in planning.

Registration includes:

  • Full program access
  • Welcome Reception
  • Exhibit Hall Happy Hour
  • Awards luncheon invitation
  • Post-conference access to presentations/recordings

Additional fees may apply to ticketed events.

Nonmember

Regular – $1,050

Register by February 13, 2019

This registration is for all other nonmember registrations, including nonmember students.

Registration includes:

  • Full program access
  • Welcome Reception
  • Exhibit Hall Happy Hour
  • Awards luncheon invitation
  • Post-conference access to presentations/recordings

Additional fees may apply to ticketed events.

Registering by Fax or Mail

Important! If you register by mail or fax, APA must receive your completed registration form and payment by the date indicated to qualify for the associated rate.

Send your registration by mail or fax

Registration Policies

Registration Policies and Essentials

Conference Speaker Policies

 

  Early Bird Pricing through February 13 Regular Pricing through March 13 Late Pricing through April 16
APA Members $735 $785 $835
APA New Members $368 $393 $418
Life, Retired, Student Members $125 $145 $165
Nonmember Planning Officials $735 $840 $890
Nonmembers $1,050 $1,050 $1,050

Join APA Now and Save on NPC19!

If you're not an APA member, join now for the best price on NPC19. Registration rates are lower across the board for APA members, and especially for student and new members:

  • If you're enrolled as a full-time student in any college or university degree program, join APA now for FREE and pay only $125 by February 13 to attend NPC19. (More good news: your APA membership will be FREE until you complete your studies.)
    Learn more about student membership.
  • Not a student? Join APA now at HALF OFF regular member dues and register for NPC18 at HALF OFF the regular member rate.
    Check out our special offer for new members.

Students and new members receive all the benefits of regular APA membership, and more.

Join APA

Key Dates

December 12, 2018 Member-only registration opens
January 9, 2019 Nonmember registration opens
February 13, 2019
(11:59 p.m. CT)		 Early registration ends; rates go up on February 13
March 13, 2019
(11:59 p.m. CT)		 Regular registration ends; rates go up on March 13
Register by March 13 to receive your badge and tickets in the mail before NPC19 begins
description: Details on how to register for APA's National Planning Conference.

title: Program
text:
April 13–16, 2019 — San Francisco

Want to move to the forefront of planning? Attend NPC19 and pack learning, sharing, connecting, and fun into four exciting days. NPC19's robust educational program covers emerging issues, new trends, and best practices in planning.

Want to dig deeper on a specific planning topic? Check out our 13 conference tracks to delve into topics like disaster resilience, housing, and planning for social justice.

View Full Program

 

Program Glossary

Here's quick overview of the program terminology to help you make the best schedule for you.

Sessions

Here is the heart of the conference: hundreds of opportunities to learn the very latest about myriad planning topics from the people who know them best. Sessions last 75 minutes and most offer CM credit.

Deep Dive Sessions

Dig in deeper with these extended, more in-depth sessions about planning challenges and innovations.

Mobile Workshops & Orientation Tours

Get an up-close and personal view of San Francisco on an orientation tour led by local planners, on foot or by boat. Go granular on mobile workshops that visit leading-edge planning in progress in one-of-a-kind San Francisco.

Tracks

Conference tracks cover multiple aspects of important and emerging topics. This year's track topics range from disaster recovery to international planning.

Networking Events & Receptions

Looking to expand your network? In addition to the numerous networking breaks throughout the day, more than 30 additional opportunities await you, including events that are unique to our host city. Receptions are open to all unless otherwise noted.

Meetings

APA leaders and its component groups (chapters, divisions, students) are here to take care of business. So are other groups and a number of APA partners. Meetings are open to all attendees unless otherwise noted.

Program Links

Full Program

Featured Events

title: Travel
text:
April 13–16, 2019 — San Francisco

The city of San Francisco and the surrounding Bay Area embody many different landscapes, from urban to suburban to rural. The area is famous for its world-renowned culture, iconic landmarks, and breathtaking views.

Experience Our Host City

The City by the Bay

Get lost, in a good way, in the majesty of San Francisco.

  • Hotel & Travel Info
  • Things to Do

Things to Do

Get Active

San Francisco consistently ranks as one of the happiest, healthiest, and fittest cities in the country. It's not hard to understand why with all the active opportunities the city offers.

  • Experience some of the country’s best public parks like Golden Gate Park, the Presidio, and Mission Dolores Park.
  • Go for a hike without leaving the city by checking out Glen Canyon Park, the Bay Ridge Trail, Mt. Davidson, or Lands End.
  • Get around on two wheels. San Francisco is one of the top-rated biking cities. Cruise through town via shared bike lanes or bike trails.

Arts & Culture

This vibrant city and its diverse cultural influences can be sensed in every corner of its 49 square miles and beyond to the Bay Area. The city is always bursting with things to do like live music, art, theater, and more.

  • Tour the murals of the Mission District's alleys and buildings where you'll find over 200 distinct murals, many reflecting the neighborhood's Latino heritage.
  • Touch, tinker, and play with more than 650 hands-on exhibits at the Exploratorium. The immersive art installation, Fog Bridge, is always a fan favorite.
  • The Beat Generation found its voice in San Francisco. Visit City Lights, where Allen Ginsburg's Howl & Other Poems was first published, to catch up with today's indie-literary voices.

Food

The proximity of the freshest ingredients and competitive creativity of the chefs result in unforgettable dining experiences throughout San Francisco. There are endless ways to fill up, but here are a few highlights.

  • Grab a bite in the country's largest Chinatown at Hunan Home's Restaurant
  • Slurp up some Cioppino, invented in San Francisco, at Sotto Mare
  • Eat up San Francisco classics at the 100-year-old Swan Oyster Depot
description: The city of San Francisco and the surrounding Bay Area embodies many different landscapes from urban to suburban to rural.

title: About NPC19
text:
April 13-16, 2019 — San Francisco

APA's 2019 National Planning Conference is the premier planning event of the year. NPC19 will bring together the hottest topics, the latest tools, and the leading voices with something new to say.

With hundreds of sessions and cutting-edge presentations on offer, you can dig deeper into your specialty or explore new topics.

Planning Connects Us.

NPC19 isn't just about planning — it's about building a community of great planners.

  • Why Attend NPC19?
  • General Information
  • CM & CEU Credits
  • The Venue
  • News & Media
Register Now

We bring together thousands of planners, planning commissioners, appointed and elected officials, and students to discuss fresh ideas and innovative planning. The National Planning Conference is the best place to find a mentor, connect with colleagues, and meet planners from around the world.

This year's program includes numerous networking opportunities and the Career Zone's popular Mentor Match, Resume Clinic, and Employer Connection.

NPC19 Registration Includes:

  • All sessions
  • Welcome Reception at Moscone West
  • Opening and closing keynotes
  • Exhibit Hall Happy Hour
  • Awards Luncheon invitation*
    (full paid registration only — see Policies for details)
  • Access to a majority of session recordings after the conference

*Important! If you plan to attend the Awards Luncheon, be sure to reserve a ticket before the conference begins. Space is limited, and we expect all available tickets to be claimed.

Use Our Conference-at-a-Glance for a Snapshot

Where Has NPC Been? Where Is It Going?

Future & Previous Conferences
description: Join the conversation about new issues, trends, challenges, and solutions that are shaping planning today. Get smarter at sessions and workshops offering the latest and best in professional planning education.
